intro: Rhynchospora modesti-lucennoi, commonly known as the modest lucennoi sedge, is a flowering plant species belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. This plant typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded habitats, such as marshes and wet meadows. Its morphology includes a rhizomatous root system, which helps it spread and establish in moist environments. Rhynchospora modesti-lucennoi is often found in the Neotropics, particularly in regions of South America.
